title: Maryland suspects face manslaughter charges after crashing in construction zone, killing 6 workers
description: Two Maryland suspects were arrested this week for their involvement in a crash that resulted in one car flipping over in a construction zone and killing six crew members.

title: Help desperately needed: American Heart Association launches 'Be a Lifesaver' program
description: Each year, June 1-7 is National CPR and AED Awareness Week — and more lives could be saved if more Americans knew CPR. Fox News Digital spoke with the American Heart Association's Nancy Brown.

title: Parents' rights group warns Southern Poverty Law Center 'hate group' label will lead to increased violence
description: A parental rights group's executive director, Suzanne Gallagher, reacted to the Southern Poverty Law Center labeling them as an anti-government hate group.

title: Julia Louis-Dreyfus recalls working with 'tender' late 'Sopranos' star James Gandolfini: 'A teddy bear'
description: Julia Louis-Dreyfus remembered her late co-star James Gandolfini as a "teddy bear." She recalled that "The Sopranos" actor was very different from the character he played.

title: Suns release veteran All-Star Chris Paul as more changes come to Phoenix: report
description: The Phoenix Suns reportedly let future Hall of Fame point guard Chris Paul know that he will be released, as they don't want to pay his $30 million price tag for next season.

title: Biden joins AOC in linking Canadian wildfires to 'climate crisis'
description: President Biden joined Democratic New York Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez in linking the ongoing Canadian wildfires to the "climate crisis."

title: Bills' Josh Allen named Madden 24 cover athlete, first Buffalo player to receive honor
description: Buffalo Bills quarterback Josh Allen is the first player from the organization to be on the cover of the Madden video game, Allen will be on the cover of Madden 24.

title: Mike Pence: 2024 bid will 'test' whether GOP changed, Trump and others 'walking away from US leadership'
description: Former Vice President Mike Pence sounded off on Fox News' 'America Reports' after announcing a bid for the 2024 Republican presidential nomination.

title: DeSantis defends migrant flights to California, blames sanctuary jurisdictions for encouraging 'open border'
description: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis said Wednesday that sanctuary jurisdictions who advocated for "open-border policies" should bear the brunt of the ongoing migrant crisis.

title: Federal judge blocks New York counties' attempt to protect local hotels from becoming migrant shelters
description: A federal judge on Tuesday shut down attempts by two New York counties to halt the transportation of hundreds of migrants from an overwhelmed New York City.

title: Political violence rocks Senegal, threatens stability, as nation closes overseas consulates
description: Senegal's Ministry of Foreign Affairs has announced the precautionary closure of its overseas consulates amid widespread unrest over the conviction of opposition leader Ousmane Sonko.

title: Salma Hayek goes makeup-free as she counts ‘white hairs and wrinkles’
description: Actress Salma Hayek showed off her all-natural look in an Instagram selfie. The 56-year-old displayed her grey hairs and creased forehead in the candid snap.

title: NBA Finals: As series shifts to Miami, the pressure shifts to the Nuggets
description: After losing Game 1 against the Denver Nuggets, the Miami Heat rallied late to win Game 2 by three points. As the series moves to South Florida, the pressure is on the Nuggets.

title: Florida's Rep. Gaetz says Speaker McCarthy must be 'forced into monogamy' with conservatives or Democrats

title: Missouri Gov. Mike Parsons signs bill banning transgender health care for minors, competition in school sports
description: Missouri Gov. Mike Parson signed a pair of bills into law that bans sex change surgery for minors and forces transgender athletes to compete on teams that match their biological sex.

title: Lawmaker calls out 'unaccountable, nontransparent committee' for banning the Bible in Utah school district
description: Utah legislator Rep. Ken Ivory said he plans to take action to ensure the law he sponsored to ban inappropriate materials in schools is not used on religious texts.

title: Pat Cooper, comedian and Sinatra opener, dead at 93
description: Stand-up comedian Pat Cooper died on Tuesday at his home in Las Vegas, Nevada. The longtime comic opened for Frank Sinatra and often appeared on Ed Sullivan.

title: 49ers' Brock Purdy 'ahead of schedule' in rehab following elbow surgery
description: San Francisco 49ers quarterback Brock Purdy is "ahead of schedule" in his rehab from a torn UCL, head coach Kyle Shanahan told reporters Tuesday.

title: Poland and Germany collaborate to protect river from deadly pollution, discuss prevention strategies
description: The environment ministers of Poland and Germany held a meeting at the border of their countries to address the protection of a river from potential recurrence of pollution.

title: Healthy pet: Keeping beloved animals safe as heavy wildfire smoke drifts across parts of US
description: As smoke drifts across parts of the U.S. from Western Canadian wildfires, pets are at risk just as humans are. Two veterinarians offer best tips and symptoms in case your pet becomes ill.

title: CNN media reporter delivers brutal on-air assessment of CEO Chris Licht's tenure: 'Series of severe missteps'
description: CNN media reporter Oliver Darcy remarked on Chris Licht stepping down as CNN's CEO Wednesday, claiming his time consisted of a "series of severe missteps."

description: Hawaii's second-largest volcano, Kilauea, erupted for the second time in 2023 on Wednesday, shooting fire and lava into the sky.

title: Serbia's president announces early elections amid protests, tragic shootings
description: In response to widespread protests and two recent mass shootings that deeply affected the nation, Serbia's President Aleksandar Vucic has pledged to hold early parliamentary elections.

title: Kentucky chemical weapons disposal facility nears completion of decades-long mission
description: A facility in Kentucky that is dedicated to disposing of Cold War-era chemical weapons is approaching the final stages of its mission to destroy a 520-ton stockpile.

description: Soccer legend Lionel Messi's next team will be in MLS as he said he intends to join Inter Miami next season after considering a return to Barcelona or joining Saudi Arabia's league.

description: House Democrats' responses ranged from deference to outright disapproval of the idea for debate between President Joe Biden and 2024 primary challenger Robert F. Kennedy Jr.
